sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

sentences.english: female voters
sentences.chinese: 女性选民

sentences.english: Over half of the staff is female.
sentences.chinese: 半数以上的员工是女性。

detailed_translations.english: relating to women or girls
an animal that belongs to the sex that can have babies or produce eggs

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

sentences.english: Bird evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg--laid by a reptile.
sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.english: No matter how dry your skin gets, you will never turn into an alligator or any other type of reptile.
sentences.chinese: 不论皮肤多么干燥，你永远不会变成美洲鳄或任何其他一种皮肤粗糙的爬行动物。

sentences.english: This small reptile, which measures just 10 centimeters long, can swim through the sand dunes at up to 15 centimeters per second.
sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

sentences.english: At first this amphibian deals with the cooler days by burying itself in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 起初，天气乍凉的时候，这种两栖动物将自己埋在土壤里。

sentences.english: Why does the speaker choose that amphibian as her representative of a public creature?
sentences.chinese: 诗人为何选择这个两栖动物作为公众人物的代表？

sentences.english: "Almost all of them were abandoned somewhere in the city, " said Wu Weichun, the director of the zoo's amphibian department, to the Shanghai Dailynewspaper.
sentences.chinese: “它们中几乎所有都是在城市里被遗弃的，”动物园两栖动物馆主任吴文春对《上海每日新闻报》说。

detailed_translations.english: an animal such as a  frog  that can live both on land and in water

sentences.english: The heavy rains and flooding killed scores of livestock.
sentences.chinese: 大雨和洪水淹死了许多家畜。

detailed_translations.english: animals such as cows and sheep that are kept on a farm

sentences.english: herds of cattle
sentences.chinese: 成群的牛

sentences.english: a cattle rancher
sentences.chinese: 牧牛场场主

detailed_translations.english: cows and  bulls  kept on a farm for their meat or milk

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

sentences.english: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

detailed_translations.english: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

sentences.english: His church became a sanctuary for thousands of people who fled the civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他的教堂成了数千逃避内战的人们的一个避难所。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避难所；至圣所；耶路撒冷的神殿
detailed_translations.english: a peaceful place that is safe and provides protection, especially for people who are in danger

sentences.english: wildlife conservation
sentences.chinese: 野生生物保护

sentences.english: a local conservation group
sentences.chinese: 当地的一个环境保护团体

detailed_translations.english: the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, forests etc, to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed

sentences.english: The road to the zoo turns off here.
sentences.chinese: 通向动物园的路由这儿拐弯。

sentences.english: The parrots in the zoo are popping all the time.
sentences.chinese: 动物园里的鹦鹉一直在生小鹦鹉。

sentences.english: Lionesses bearing cubs in the zoo is nothing new now.
sentences.chinese: 狮子在动物园繁殖早已屡见不鲜了。

detailed_translations.english: a place, usually in a city, where animals of many kinds are kept so that people can go to look at them

sentences.english: The dog wagged its tail .
sentences.chinese: 那条狗摇了摇尾巴。

detailed_translations.english: the part that sticks out at the back of an animal’s body, and that it can move

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

sentences.english: He punched him on the jaw.
sentences.chinese: 他一拳打在他的下巴上。

sentences.english: a rugged physique and a strong square jaw
sentences.chinese: 强健的体格以及结实的方下巴

sentences.english: She’s got a very determined jaw.
sentences.chinese: 她一脸坚毅。

detailed_translations.english: the lower part of your face. Its shape is sometimes thought to show your character

sentences.english: Joe ran his tongue over his dry lips.
sentences.chinese: 乔舔了舔干燥的嘴唇。

sentences.english: The taste of the chocolate was still on her tongue.
sentences.chinese: 巧克力的余味依然留在她的舌尖。

sentences.english: The girl scowled at me, then stuck out her tongue .
sentences.chinese: 女孩怒视着我，然后吐了一下舌头。

detailed_translations.english: the soft part inside your mouth that you can move about and use for eating and speaking
to use your tongue to make separate sounds when playing a musical instrument

sentences.english: The horse's mane can be washed at the same time as his body.
sentences.chinese: 马的鬃毛可以随其身体一起刷洗。

detailed_translations.english: the long hair on the back of a horse’s neck, or around the face and neck of a lion

sentences.english: ...a black bird with a yellow beak.
sentences.chinese: …一只有着黄喙的黑鸟。

detailed_translations.english: the hard pointed mouth of a bird

sentences.english: The cat dug his claws into my leg.
sentences.chinese: 猫的爪子抓进了我的腿中。

sentences.english: lobster claws
sentences.chinese: 龙虾的螯

detailed_translations.english: a sharp curved nail on an animal, bird, or some insects
to tear or pull at something, using claws or your fingers

sentences.english: an ostrich feather
sentences.chinese: 一根鸵鸟羽毛

detailed_translations.english: one of the light soft things that cover a bird’s body
